results.title: Friluft: 'The call of the open-air'
results.creator_credit: Dansk Kulturfilm, Minerva Films and Jorgen Roos
results.brief_description: A lighthearted historical cross-section of the open air movement. This film covers outdoor sports/recreation activities throughout Danish history, commenting that Danes first started the scout movement in 1909 and the Youth Hostel movement in 1930 for example. Increasing urbanisation in the cities resulted in society becoming more inward, preferring to stay indoors rather than being sporty as their ancestors once were. As female clothing became freer, along with loosening social mores, people began to go outdoors once more. Chiefly based on original historical material-paintings, engravings, photographs and old films, contrasting with the final live action sequence of present-day. Danish language with English sub-titles. Music by Bent Fabricius-Bjerre and written by Tork Haxthausen.

results.title: Fright night
results.creator_credit: Herb Jaffe, Columbia Pictures and Tom Holland
results.brief_description: Charlie Brewster is a teenage horror buff who becomes engrossed in the mysterious goings on at the spooky house next door, especially when people are reported as missing, who later turn up decapitated. As well as facing the troubles with his girlfriend, Brewster has difficulty convincing anyone (including the police and his mother) of the wicked deeds being committed. Instead he enlists the help of television horror personality Peter Vincent (Roddy McDowall), a horror actor who has fallen on hard times. Together Brewster and Vincent must combat the dreadful evil of Dandridge (Chris Sarandon) and Billy Cole (Jonathan Stark), his menacing assistant. Director Tom Holland (Child’s play) ably blends comedy with suspense in a vampire thriller that makes good use of 1980s special effects and the exuberance of his cast, especially William Ragsdale as the harried teen.

results.title: Friendship beats the storm
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Eliza Goldsmith, Kiera Chapman and ACMI
results.brief_description: Best friends Kiera Chapman and Eliza Goldsmith have been through quite a lot together. When Chapman’s family took shelter during the torando that hit Lennox Head in 2010, Goldsmith cut her feet running over to see if Chapman was ok. As they weathered the storm together, they share the experience with their family, community and with each other.

results.title: Friendship's Death
results.brief_description: In September 1970, a British war correspondent is distracted from his coverage of the conflict between Palestinians and Jordanians when he rescues a young lady from a PLO patrol. Named Friendship, she claims to be an extra terrestrial robot sent to Earth on a peace mission and accidentally diverted from her original destination, The Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Is she insane, a spy, or telling the truth? Wollen’s film comes across as a two-set Dr Who for adults, complete with political, philosophical and personal problems. Rated: M

results.title: Friends of the family
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Derek Lamb, David Verrall and Yossi Abolafia
results.brief_description: An animated children’s film that illustrates the different projects that UNICEF uses its funds for. Two young children suddenly find that their own comfortable home surroundings have disappeared and that they are in a very poor village that does not even have a water pump. UNICEF comes to the rescue! Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Friends and other people
results.creator_credit: Centre for Study of Higher Education
results.brief_description: A teaching model used to educate the intellectually disabled about types of relationships, clarifying social norms and behavioural expectations,in order to deal with loneliness, low self esteem and vulnerability to exploitation. Includes a booklet by Susie Smith and Judi Gray.

results.title: Friends and neighbors = Friends and neighbours
results.creator_credit: Jack Wipper, Sterling Educational Films, Lori Productions and Edmund Penney
results.brief_description: Investigates learning to live together, how to treat friends and neighbours, and shows how it is often easy to take advantage of the weak and gullible and to ignore social responsibility. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
